answers.answer: Hi everyone,I have had left sided headache for 3 years which turned to cronic daily headache for the last 6 months - almost unbearable.  I have had a couple  MRI's of the head. Unfortunately, had to change Insurance company in the middle of all this and start with Primary Physician and Nurologist from the beginning again. No prescribed drugs have helped -  including Topamax.  I am  scheduled for nerve block and MRA of the cervical spine. I am very  happy that my Neurologist is moving forward and trying to help me -- just wondering if anyone had same situation and received a medical diagnosis?  Prior to all this happening,  I never had a headache in my entire life.

question: How much does a MRA of the head and throat show?  Does it just show the vessels, or are there bonuses, like seeing if my thyroid looks right, or my pituitary, or anything like that?The orders for the tests list the reason for tests as "numbness".  I'm not sure why, but will that affect what the radiologists focus on, or do they check everything out?  My symptoms are dizziness, tremors, loss of balance, fatigue, parasthesia, plus more.I had 2 MRIs that showed multiple small lesions in the white matter, and though I'm 46 and have had great blood pressure, cholesterol, etc. for many years, and never a sign of diabetes.Any ideas?Kathy
title: MRA of Head and Throat
